intro: Hemitelia kegelii, commonly known as the Kegel's hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
